ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I engaged with an immense amount of literature that dealt with themes of time, identity, trauma, and more. I gained valuable literary insights and honed my writing skills through this seminar!

I have learned to be able to truly close read a passage. From that I have been able to gain meaning such as why artistic and stylistic choices are very important. I have become a much better writer and have been able to significantly improve my writing skills. Specifically, I have become clearer, and better at elucidating arguments. My structure has improved, and I have incorporated stronger idea-driven topic sentences, and productive clarification. Most importantly, I have learned the value of shorter sentences in my prose.
I developed a stronger ability to close read and communicate more complex ideas about a given text. I also was able to develop my grammatical skills in order to write clearer essays.
close reading, concision in argument, well structured arguments
I significantly improved my writing skills and would say I am comfortable writing at the college level now.
This class took an in-depth look at the meaning of time and how our perception of time depends on many different factors.
I polished my critical thinking and argumentative writing skills. Additionally, we went over some fundamental grammar lessons.
English reading and writing skills.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: I really enjoyed the format of the course as the seminar allowed me to really engage with Trina and my classmates to learn more about critically analyzing literature and developing thoughtful works in relation to eveything we read.

Strengths are the readings are mostly engaging other than the very academic ones, which are hard to read
Another strength is the drafts, which are beneficial to making corrections and improvements. 
Weaknesses are that the last essay being the length it is takes away from the close reading and forces us to dilute the quality of the work.

I liked the class's small size, and the readings were expertly selected. The professor truly knew how to facilitate the seminar environment. I have no criticisms of the actual course. However, the one minor thing I would say is that the syllabus/course introduction mentioned texts and films that were not a part of the actual class, which may be misleading at first glance.
This course was really great. There were a lot of readings, but that is to be expected from a literature course.
Good course.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes! I would absolutely recommend this course to another student because it is one of the best courses I have taken here at Yale!
I would recommend this course to another student looking for the writing credit, because this section was engaging and very useful in improving writing skills.
Yes! The texts that were chosen were incredibly engaging and thought provoking. Trina is also an excellent TF who helped facilitate discussion as well as provide clear feedback.

yes. professor hyun was one of my favorite instructors from this term she was so helpful in her feedback and facilitating our class conversations. The readings were all carefully selected and added so much to my intellectual journey at yale.
Yes, I would. It really helps with your writing development.
I would recommend this course to another student. The topic of time is very abstract b it really makes you think and you start to observe your every day life with a new lens.

Yes, I would absolutely recommend this course to another student. There is a lot of writing at Yale, so establishing a good foundation is a must. This is a great course to get accustomed to the academic rigors and expectations for quality writing.
Yes, if they are interested in reading.
